item.title: OpenAI hires team behind AI recommendation startup Crossing Minds
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Crossing Minds, a startup that provides AI recommendation systems to e-commerce firms, said its team is leaving the company to join OpenAI.

item.title: Meta in talks to acquire voice cloning startup Play AI
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta is in talks to acquire a voice cloning startup called Play AI, Bloomberg reported, citing anonymous sources.

item.title: Redwood Materials launches energy storage business and its first target is AI data centers
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Tim De Chant
item.description: Redwood Materials has launched a new business — taking old EV batteries to store energy and help power businesses.

item.title: This AI-powered startup studio plans to launch 100,000 companies a year — really
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Henrik Werdelin has spent the last 15 years helping entrepreneurs build big brands like Barkbox through his startup studio Prehype. Now, with his new, New York-based venture Audos, he’s betting that AI can help him scale that process from “tens” of startups a year to “hundreds of thousands” of aspiring business owners. The timing certainly […]

item.title: At TechCrunch All Stage, Jahanvi Sardana shares how top startups reshape markets
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch All Stage — the ultimate founder summit — is shaping up to be a powerhouse event where 1,200 founders and VCs across all stages will come together to forge meaningful connections and gain practical insights they can immediately apply to scale their startups. Join us on July 15 at SoWa Power Station in Boston […]

item.title: Google launches Doppl, a new app that lets you visualize how an outfit might look on you
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Google is launching a new experimental app called Doppl that uses AI to visualize how different outfits might look on you.

item.title: Why a16z VC believes that Cluely, the ‘cheat on everything’ startup, is the new blueprint for AI startups
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Andreessen Horowitz explains why its new investment philosophy prioritizes the "build as you go" approach embodied by Cluely.

item.title: TechCrunch All Stage: Learn how AI can supercharge your MVPs with Chris Gardner
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch All Stage, our big event for founders of startups at all stages of funding (see what we did there?), is coming up July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station. And it’s our pleasure to announce that Underscore VC’s investing partner Chris Gardner will join a loaded lineup of speakers by leading a breakout session […]

item.title: Apple updates the rules for its EU App Store by adding more complicated fees
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple on Thursday announced a series of updates to its developer policies to comply with the EU’s Digital Markets Act (DMA). The news, which was expected, arrived just in time to meet the deadline of June 26, after which the iPhone maker would risk new fines. The changes involve both how app developers can communicate […]

item.title: Travis Kalanick is trying to buy Pony AI — and Uber might help
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Uber is reportedly in talks to help fund Travis Kalanick's potential acquisition of Pony AI, which has a market cap of around $4.5 billion.

item.title: Windows killed the Blue Screen of Death
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Why change the blue screen to black now? Did the viral images of Times Square rendered useless by the BSOD cause that much reputational harm?

item.title: In just 3 months, CoreWeave CEO, once a crypto-mining bro, becomes a deca-billionaire
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: CoreWeave remains a symbol of the AI industry in 2025: Massive revenue and investor enthusiasm built on an insatiable need for more.

item.title: Threads now lets you manage Hidden Words separately from Instagram, set time limits
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The feature allows you to filter out posts that contain words, phrases, or emojis you don’t want to see in feeds, search, profiles, and replies.

item.title: Google Photos merges classic search with AI to speed up results
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The AI feature, first introduced at Google's I/O developer conference last year, allows users to search across their collection of digital photos using natural language queries.

item.title: Uber has Atlanta’s autonomous ride-hailing and delivery market on lock
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Uber Eats customers in Atlanta can now opt in to have their food delivered via sidewalk delivery robots, following partner Serve Robotics’s launch on Thursday. The move comes just two days after Uber and Waymo launched a commercial robotaxi service in the city.

item.title: Rivian cuts dozens on manufacturing team ahead of R2 launch
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The company laid off around 1% of its total workforce, or around 140 employees. It's the third round of cuts since the start of 2024.

item.title: Elon Musk reportedly fires Tesla’s top sales exec
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Omead Afshar, one of Musk's top lieutenants, is out after more than seven years at the company. He was elevated to a VP role in late 2024.

item.title: US, French authorities confirm arrest of BreachForums hackers
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Kai West was arrested in France, along with four other hackers, all suspected of being part of the well-known hacking forum, BreachForums.

item.title: Homeland Security warns of Iran-backed cyberattacks targeting US networks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: DHS said low-level cyberattacks targeting U.S. networks are "likely" in the wake of military conflict between the U.S. and Israel and Iran.

item.title: Meta hires key OpenAI researcher to work on AI reasoning models
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: In recent months, Mark Zuckerberg has been on a hiring spree to build out Meta's new AI team, offering $100 million compensation packages to top researchers who join his company.
